title: Man Utd news: Ole Gunnar Solskjaer tips Brandon Williams to become 'top, top player'
text:
Brandon Williams was a bright spark in Manchester United’s win against Partizan Belgrade (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer has tipped Brandon Williams to become a ‘top, top player’ following his performance in the side’s 1-0 win against Partizan Belgrade.

The 19-year-old was making just his second start for the club as Anthony Martial’s spot kick gave the Red Devils a crucial three points in Serbia.

Martial’s goal was United’s only shot on target and Solskjaer admitted afterwards that he was far from pleased with elements of the performance.

However, the Norwegian reserved praise for Williams and says United have ‘found’ a new left-back.

Solskjaer was unhappy with elements of United’s win (Picture: Getty)

‘Brandon was Man of the Match,’ said Solskjaer.

‘He’s been fantastic in the games he’s played, the boy has no fear, he’s as brave as a lion and he got us the win. He’s going to be a top, top player.

‘In games like these when we get the first goal, we need to learn when to get the second, when to get the third.

‘I thought today we had loads of opportunities to make sure we’re in a comfortable lead but we didn’t play that pass forward.

‘But Brandon has an absolutely great attitude. The boy is going to be a top, top player.’

United are now top of their Europa League group and have kept three clean sheets in their games so far.

They can book their spot in the last-32 with a win against Partizan Belgrade in a fortnight’s time at Old Trafford.
